Based on the user's preference cues and genre, I would recommend "The Skulls" to them.

"The Skulls" is a 2000 American thriller film directed by Rob Cohen. The movie stars Kevin Allen as Jameson ``Jake'' LaMotta, an Italian-American mobster; William Petersen as Sonny Corleone, the head of the powerful Corleone crime family from Sicily; and Craig T. Nelson as Howard Hughes, a wealthy eccentric businessman who is also one of the few people to know Hughes' entire fortune.

The story follows Jake LaMotta as he rises through the ranks at the mobbed-up New York City police department, where he works as an officer under Captain William Murphy (William Petersen).

The movie starts off by showing Jake's wife, Maureen (Lisa Bonnell), trying to get Jake to come home with her. Instead, Jake goes into a bar and drinks until he falls asleep on the floor. The next day, Maureen comes to Jake's workplace and tries to get him to come home with her. Jake tells Maureen that he has a lot of work to do at his workplace and that he can't just leave his job without finishing it. Maureen tells Jake that she understands that Jake needs to finish his work at his workplace before he can leave his job, but that she still wants Jake to come home with her. Jake tells Maureen that he still wants to come home with Maureen, but that he needs to finish his work at his workplace first before he can come home with Maureen.
